workflow.name: Automated LinkedIn company page growth with Browserflow and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## Automate LinkedIn Company Page Growth End-to-End

- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Important ‚Äî Start Here**
- Before importing this template, **make a personal copy of the provided [Google Sheets template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-zak-RUGU4ubw3aZ_9lF9LF1dxEo9ME_-mtzRGtIDFg/edit?gid=0#gid=0)**.
- This workflow is designed to work **out of the box** with that sheet.

![Screenshot 20251216 at 09.26.02.png](fileId:3673)

Growing a LinkedIn Company Page usually requires time, consistency, and manual outreach.
With **Browserflow + n8n**, you can turn the entire process into a **hands-off LinkedIn growth engine**.

This template automates everything from:

* Scraping LinkedIn engagement
* Sending connection invites
* Tracking acceptance
* Inviting new connections to follow your company page

All activity is logged, deduplicated, and fully automated.

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Disclaimer ‚Äì Community Node Notice

This template uses a **verified community node** available inside the n8n Cloud environment.

To use it:

* Go to **Nodes**
* Search for **Browserflow for Linkedin**
* Click **Install**

If you are running n8n locally:

* Go to **Settings ‚Üí Community Nodes**
* Search for **n8n-nodes-browserflow**
* Install and restart n8n

---


## üì¶ Requirements

To use this template, you need:

* n8n (Cloud or self-hosted)
* Installed community node: **Browserflow for Linkedin**
* An account for [Browserflow (7-day free trial)](Browserflow (7-day free trial))
* LinkedIn account
* A copy of the [Google Sheets template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-zak-RUGU4ubw3aZ_9lF9LF1dxEo9ME_-mtzRGtIDFg/edit?gid=0#gid=0)

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Make a copy of the provided [Google Sheets template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-zak-RUGU4ubw3aZ_9lF9LF1dxEo9ME_-mtzRGtIDFg/edit?gid=0#gid=0)**
2. **Import the n8n template into your n8n workflow**
3. Create an account with [Browserflow (7-day free trial)](Browserflow (7-day free trial))
3. Reconnect credentials:

   * Google Sheets
   * Browserflow (API key via credentials)
4. (Optional) Adjust schedule intervals if needed
5. Add your Company Page URL in the final workflow

That‚Äôs it ‚Äî no column mapping required if you use the sheet as provided.

---

## ü§ñ Tip ‚Äì Quickly Switch to Your Own Google Sheet Using n8n AI (Beta)

If you already imported the workflow and want to swap the Google Sheet later, you can use the **n8n AI assistant (beta)**.

Paste this prompt (replace the URL):

```
I would like to change all my google sheets integrations to use the following sheet instead: ******

It has the exact same sheets and tables and fields
```

The AI will update all Google Sheets nodes automatically.

---


## üß© What This Template Does

This template consists of **four connected workflows**, each represented with **sticky notes** inside n8n.

### üîç Step 1 ‚Äì Retrieve Leads from LinkedIn Post Engagement

This workflow scrapes users who engage with LinkedIn posts and stores them in Google Sheets.

**Workflow actions:**

* Fetch LinkedIn post URLs from Google Sheets
* Scrape:

  * Commenters
  * (Optional) Likers
* Split results into individual profiles
* Filter invalid or duplicate profiles
* Append new leads to Google Sheets
* Mark posts as ‚Äúscraped‚Äù to prevent reprocessing

---

### ü§ù Step 2 ‚Äì Send LinkedIn Connection Invites Automatically

This workflow sends connection requests to new leads on a schedule.

**Workflow actions:**

* Schedule trigger (e.g. every 10 minutes)
* Fetch leads not yet invited
* Check connection status:

  * ‚ùå Not connected ‚Üí Send invite
  * ‚è≥ Pending ‚Üí Mark as pending
  * ‚úÖ Connected ‚Üí Mark as connected
* Update Google Sheets with status + timestamp

---

### üîÑ Step 3 ‚Äì Track Connection Acceptance

This workflow keeps your lead sheet accurate by tracking accepted invitations.

**Workflow actions:**

* Scheduled trigger
* Fetch recent LinkedIn connections via Browserflow
* Match profiles with Google Sheets
* Update:

  * Connection status
  * Acceptance timestamp

---

### ‚≠ê Step 4 ‚Äì Invite Connections to Follow Your Company Page

Once someone accepts your connection request, this workflow invites them to follow your Company Page.

**Workflow actions:**

* Fetch connected leads from Google Sheets
* Filter:

  * Connected
  * Not yet invited to follow
* Use Browserflow to:

  * Visit your LinkedIn Connections page
  * Send ‚ÄúInvite to Follow Page‚Äù action
* Update follow-invite status in Google Sheets

**Important configuration:**

* Enter your **Company Page URL**
* You must be **Admin** of the page

---


## üìä Final Result ‚Äì Your Automated LinkedIn Growth Engine

After setup, you get:

* üîç Automated lead scraping from niche engagement
* ü§ù Automated LinkedIn connection requests
* üîÑ Automatic acceptance tracking
* ‚≠ê Automated Company Page follow invites
* üìä Centralized Google Sheets dashboard

This system saves hours every week and turns every new connection into a Company Page follower ‚Äî **with zero manual work**.

---

## üöÄ Need Help?

If you need help customizing or extending this automation, feel free to reach out.
Happy automating! üöÄ

parameters.content:
## Retrieve Leads from Post comments
This workflow gets leads by scraping people that reacted under a post ands stores them in Google Sheets

## Invite Leads as a LinkedIn Connection
This part of the workflow grabs the leads, checks for their connection status and invites them if needed. It also maintains the most up-2-date status in the Sheet.

nodes.name: Fetch Leads that have not been invited
Check if a person is a connection
Send a linked in connection invite

conditions.leftValue: ={{ $('Check if a person is a connection').item.json.is_pending }}

parameters.content:
## Update Connection Status
Fetch your recent connections to check which leads have accepted your connection invite.

## Invite connections to follow page
Invite your LinkedIn Connections to Follow your page. Make sure to set the LinkedIn url of the page you are admin to

## Fully Automated LinkedIn Company Page Growth

### How it works

This workflow automates LinkedIn Company Page growth using
**[Browserflow](https://browserflow.io)** and **Google Sheets**.

It runs in four scheduled stages:

1. **Lead scraping**  
   Users who engage with selected LinkedIn posts are scraped (commenters and optionally likers). Profiles are cleaned, deduplicated, and stored in Google Sheets. Posts are marked as scraped to avoid reprocessing.

2. **Connection invites**  
   New leads are checked for their current connection status. If not connected, a LinkedIn invite is sent. Pending and already-connected profiles are logged.

3. **Acceptance tracking**  
   Accepted invitations are detected by checking your LinkedIn connections and syncing updates back to the sheet.

4. **Company Page invites**  
   Once connected, leads are automatically invited to follow your Company Page (requires admin access).

Google Sheets is used as a database so you can manage the status of your outreach campaign.

---

### Setup steps

1. Import this template into your worlkflow.
2. Install the **Browserflow for LinkedIn** community node.
3. Connect **Browserflow** using your API key (you can sign up for a free trial at
   **[Browserflow](https://browserflow.io)**).
4. Make a copy of the provided
   **[Google Sheets template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-zak-RUGU4ubw3aZ_9lF9LF1dxEo9ME_-mtzRGtIDFg/edit?gid=0#gid=0)**.
5. Update all Google Sheets nodes to point to your own copy  
   *(Pro tip: you can use the n8n AI assistant for this)*.
6. Enter your LinkedIn Company Page URL in the **Invite Connections to Follow Page** action.
7. (Optional) Adjust schedule intervals.
8. Find some posts on LinkedIn and add its urls to your Google Sheets to start scraping!

I would first recommend running each flow independently to see how it works in actiona and finally enable the workflow and let it run automatically.

main.node: Send a linked in connection invite
Check if a person is a connection

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
